item.title: 乌克兰寻找电网设备和弹药以避免夏季停电
item.description: 乌克兰能源部长格尔曼-加卢先科（German Galushchenko）说，乌克兰需要改进防空系统，以保护其能源资产免受俄罗斯导弹袭击，并避免今年夏天用电接近冬季高峰时出现停电。【原文：Ukraine needs improved air defenses to protect its energy assets from Russia’s missile attacks and avoid blackouts this summer when electricity use approaches its winter peak, Energy Minister German Galushchenko said.】

item.title: 土耳其放宽银行强制购买政府债券的规定
item.description: 土耳其进一步放宽了强制银行购买政府债券的规定，并再次降低了安全维持率，这是土耳其为结束对贷款人的惩罚性措施而采取的最新措施。【原文：Turkey further eased regulations forcing banks to buy government bonds and reduced a security maintenance ratio again in its latest steps to end punitive measures on lenders.】

item.title: 2024 年欧洲杯将帮助啤酒在今夏战胜鸡尾酒
item.description: 全球最大的酿酒商希望今年夏天温暖的天气和大型体育赛事能帮助他们从 "残酷 "的 2023 年中恢复过来；但烈酒制造商在未来几个月中仍将面临挑战。【原文：The world’s biggest brewers are hoping warmer weather and major sports events this summer will help them recover from a “brutal” 2023 — but spirit makers could still face challenges for months to come.】

item.title: 傲慢、不透明和债务引发了西格纳的急剧崩溃
item.description: 2022 年夏天，奥地利大亨雷内-本科（Rene Benko）在股东大会上大肆宣扬他花费 20 年时间打造的 Signa 房地产公司的美好未来。【原文：In the summer of 2022, Austrian tycoon Rene Benko was boasting in shareholder meetings about the promising future that lay ahead for Signa, the real estate company he had spent two decades building.】

item.title: 阳光、海洋和出口让南欧有理由踌躇满志
item.description: 南欧经济体长期以来一直被其富裕的北方邻国嗤之以鼻，但随着它们巩固了自己在增长乏力的欧元区所扮演的角色，它们已经扭转了局面。【原文：Southern European economies that were long sneered at by their richer northern neighbors have turned the tables as they cement their role as growth drivers in the sputtering euro area.】

item.title: Pantera Capital Crypto Fund 在 Solana 代币的帮助下实现 66% 的收益
item.description: Pantera Capital 大约 3 亿美元的液体代币基金在第一季度取得了 66% 的回报率，这主要得益于比特币和以太坊相关代币敞口的减少，以及 Solana 等加密货币的帮助。【原文：Pantera Capital’s roughly $300 million Liquid Token Fund finished the first quarter with a 66% return, helped by cryptocurrencies such as Solana amid reduced exposure to Bitcoin and Ethereum-linked tokens.】

item.title: 印度寻求每年 1000 亿美元的外国直接投资以吸引中国套期保值者
item.description: 印度一位高级官员表示，印度的目标是每年吸引至少 1,000 亿美元的外国直接投资总额，因为这个南亚国家正在吸引希望从中国转向多元化的投资者。【原文：India aims to attract at least $100 billion a year in gross foreign direct investment, a top official said, as the South Asian nation courts investors looking to diversify away from China.】

item.title: 马来西亚机场可能在出售 GIP 股份前私有化：边缘
item.description: 据《The Edge》援引未具名消息人士的话报道，马来西亚机场有限公司（Malaysia Airports Bhd.【原文：Malaysia Airports Bhd. could be privatized by its major shareholders before a stake sale to private equity firm Global Infrastructure Partners, according to a report in The Edge that cited unidentified sources.】

item.title: 通货膨胀仍是菲律宾公民最关心的问题：调查显示
item.description: 一项广受关注的调查显示，通货膨胀仍然是菲律宾公民最迫切关注的问题，这一最新迹象表明，顽固的物价压力可能会使决策者刺激经济增长的努力复杂化。【原文：Inflation is still the most urgent concern among Philippine citizens, a widely followed survey shows, the latest sign of how stubborn price pressures may complicate policymakers’ efforts to spur economic growth.】

item.title: 日产汽车向企业少付税款后无资格享受税收减免：读卖新闻
item.description: 读卖新闻》称，日产汽车公司不再有资格享受支持企业提高工资的减税政策，因为该汽车制造商向其承包商少支付了约 30 亿日元（2,000 万美元）的工资。【原文：Nissan Motor Co. is no longer eligible for a tax break supporting companies that raise wages, after the automaker underpaid its contractors by about ¥3 billion ($20 million), the Yomiuri Shimbun said.】

item.title: 印度炎热的夏季造就了高价股市的赢家
item.description: 印度各地酷热难耐的预测给交易商们提供了新的素材，因为他们正在寻找能在估值过高的市场中跑赢大盘的股票。【原文：Predictions of scorching heat across India are giving fresh fodder to traders as they hunt for stocks that can outperform in an overvalued market.】

item.title: 新泽西地震影响美国东海岸 4,300 万人
item.description: 据美国地质调查局估计，纽约地区发生的一个多世纪以来最大的地震在周五影响了美国东海岸的 4280 万人。【原文：The largest earthquake to hit the New York area in more than a century impacted 42.8 million people across the US East Coast on Friday, according to estimates from the United States Geological Survey.】

item.title: 韩国政党承诺在选票争夺战中使用美国比特币 ETF
item.description: 韩国国会选举的竞选活动凸显了该国作为世界上最大的加密货币市场之一的地位，两个主要政党都在兜售相关诱饵以赢得选票。【原文：Campaigning in South Korea’s parliamentary election has underlined the nation’s status as one of the world’s largest crypto markets, with both major political parties touting related inducements to win votes.】

item.title: 美国证券交易委员会赢得针对高管的新颖 "影子 "内幕交易审判
item.description: 美国证券交易委员会在其开创性的内幕交易案中赢得了陪审团的裁决，该案旨在禁止员工利用有关自己公司的非公开信息对竞争对手的股票下注。【原文：The US Securities and Exchange Commission won a jury verdict in its ground-breaking insider-trading case that sought to bar employees from using non-public information about their own company to place bets on rival stocks.】

item.title: 大宗商品交易的亿万富翁工厂上演继任大戏
item.description: 特拉菲古拉集团（Trafigura Group）打响了大宗商品贸易界高层动荡时代的发令枪，一些最大的参与者正在为新一代领导人的产生做准备，而这正是该行业受到高度关注的时刻。【原文：Trafigura Group has fired the starting gun on an era of upheaval at the top of the commodity trading world, with some of the biggest players preparing a new generation of leaders at a moment of heightened scrutiny for the industry.】

item.title: 黄金价格创新高，基金看涨押注激增
item.description: 对冲基金和基金经理将看涨黄金的押注提高到了四年来的最高点，因为贵金属的价格达到了一系列峰值。【原文：Hedge funds and money managers boosted bullish bets on gold to the highest in four years as prices of the precious metal reached a series of peaks.】

item.title: 火热经济和石油引发焦虑，市场剧烈波动占主导地位
item.description: 交易员们暗示，他们对热门经济数据的追捧是有限度的。【原文：A steady march higher in markets was snapped by a stretch of jarring volatility as traders gave hints there’s a limit to their appetite for hot economic data.】

item.title: Ares 和 Blue Owl 牵头为康泰伦特交易提供 48 亿美元私募债务
item.description: 据知情人士透露，Ares Management Corp.和 Blue Owl Capital Inc. 正在牵头组建一个私人信贷借贷集团，为收购医药制造商康泰伦特公司提供 48 亿美元的债务融资。【原文：Ares Management Corp. and Blue Owl Capital Inc. are leading a group of private credit lenders providing $4.8 billion of debt financing for the acquisition of pharmaceuticals manufacturer Catalent Inc., according to people with knowledge of the matter.】

item.title: 加纳效仿象牙海岸提高可可出场价
item.description: 在可可期货飙升之后，加纳紧随象牙海岸之后提高了支付给农民的产品价格。【原文：Ghana followed Ivory Coast to raise the price it pays farmers for their produce after cocoa futures soared.】

item.title: 安大略省对加拿大外国留学生人数上限的削减幅度较小
item.description: 作为加拿大最受留学生欢迎的省份，安大略省的新学习许可数量降幅将小于之前的估计。【原文：Ontario, Canada’s most popular province for international students, will see a smaller decline in the number of new study permits than previous estimates.】

item.title: 监狱电话公司 ViaPath 商谈 14 亿美元债务再融资事宜
item.description: 据知情人士透露，为囚犯提供电话服务的 ViaPath Technologies 公司聘请德克萨斯资本银行帮助其对约 14 亿美元的债务进行再融资。【原文：ViaPath Technologies, a company that provides phone services to prisoners, hired Texas Capital Bank to help it refinance about $1.4 billion of debt, according to people with knowledge of the matter.】

item.title: 6% 的房地产佣金如何濒临灭绝
item.description: 作为美国房屋销售的支柱，6% 的房地产佣金正受到前所未有的威胁。迫于法律压力，全美房地产经纪人协会（National Association of Realtors）已同意对其长期以来的规则进行修改，从而改变对买家和卖家代理的费用分配方式；批评人士称，这一制度使美国的佣金远高于其他国家。密苏里州的一个陪审团发现，该组织与其他组织串通一气，使佣金保持在较高水平，随后该组织达成和解，结束了一起集体诉讼。【原文：The 6% real estate commission, a mainstay of US home sales, is under threat like never before. The National Association of Realtors has agreed under legal pressure to make changes to its longstanding rules that could alter how fees are apportioned to buyers’ and sellers’ agents — a system that critics say makes commissions much higher in the US than elsewhere. The group’s settlement to end a class-action lawsuit came after a Missouri jury found that it and others had colluded to keep the fees hi】

item.title: 高盛看涨哈萨克斯坦洪灾，铀矿股票飙升
item.description: 由于世界上最大的核燃料生产国哈萨克斯坦发生洪灾，加上包括高盛集团在内的银行纷纷看涨，铀股正迎来几个月来的最佳表现。【原文：Uranium stocks are having their best run in months on a combination of flooding in Kazakhstan, the world’s largest producer of the nuclear fuel, and a burst of bullish coverage from banks including Goldman Sachs Group Inc.】

item.title: 泰晤士河水务公司债权人在肯布尔违约后正在商谈联合事宜
item.description: 泰晤士水务公司（Thames Water Utilities）的债权人在其母公司拖欠债务后开始组织潜在的重组谈判。【原文：Creditors of Thames Water Utilities have started to organize ahead of potential restructuring talks after its parent firm defaulted on its debts.】

item.title: 奇货通讯：长期繁荣
item.description: 您好，欢迎阅读《奇货》周刊，乔-魏森塔尔（Joe Weisenthal）和特蕾西-阿洛维（Tracy Alloway）将为您带来他们对市场、金融和经济领域最有趣发展的看法。【原文：Hello and welcome to the weekly Odd Lots newsletter, where Joe Weisenthal and Tracy Alloway bring you their thoughts on the most interesting developments in markets, finance and the economy.】

item.title: 荷兰央行行长称需要数字欧元来实现自治
item.description: 荷兰央行行长克拉斯-克诺（Klaas Knot）周五表示，欧洲需要一种数字欧元，"以跟上社会发展的步伐，追求战略自主，并在数字世界中保持公共资金的可及性"。【原文：Europe needs a digital euro “to keep up with society, to pursue strategic autonomy, and to maintain access to public money in a digital world,” Dutch central bank chief Klaas Knot said on Friday.】

item.title: 得克萨斯州将由 Dimensional 和 Intech 取代被赶下台的贝莱德集团
item.description: 德克萨斯州永久学校基金在上个月宣布将终止贝莱德对 85 亿美元资产的管理后，又选择了 Dimensional Fund Advisors 和 Intech 作为新的资金管理人。【原文：The Texas Permanent School Fund has selected Dimensional Fund Advisors and Intech as new money managers after announcing it would terminate BlackRock’s management of $8.5 billion in assets last month.】

item.title: 斯里兰卡与债券持有人计划本月举行新一轮债务谈判
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，全球投资者和斯里兰卡官员预计将于本月晚些时候举行第二轮会谈，旨在重组 120 亿美元的全球违约债券。【原文：Global investors and Sri Lanka officials expect to hold a second round of talks aimed at restructuring $12 billion in defaulted global bonds later this month, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 曾在奥运会上表演跳马的 Trafigura 权力经纪人即将离职
item.description: 几十年来，全球商品交易领域最有权势的人物之一一直是幕后交易者，他的第二职业是奥运会障碍赛。【原文：For decades, one of the most powerful figures in global commodity trading has been a behind-the-scenes dealmaker with a second career in Olympic showjumping.】

item.title: 萨默斯称热门就业数据显示美联储中性利率 "高得多
item.description: 前财政部长劳伦斯-萨默斯（Lawrence Summers）表示，美国 3 月份的就业人数激增表明，美联储对中性利率的估计存在偏差，并告诫美联储不要在 6 月份采取任何降息行动。【原文：Former Treasury Secretary Lawrence Summers said that the surge in US payrolls in March illustrates that the Federal Reserve is well off in its estimate of where the neutral interest rate is, and cautioned against any move to lower rates in June.】
